description: View and interact with web applications directly inside VS Code using Microsoft Edge. Open multiple browser instances side-by-side with device emulation support.
command.attach.title: Attach to a target
command.launch.title: Launch Edge and then attach to a target
command.openSettings.title: Open Settings
command.launchHtml.title: Open Browser with DevTools
command.launchScreencast.title: Open Browser
command.newBrowserWindow.title: New Browser Window
command.listOpenBrowsers.title: List Open Browsers
command.switchToBrowser.title: Switch to Browser
command.closeCurrentBrowser.title: Close Current Browser
command.navigateBrowser.title: Navigate Browser to URL
configuration.title: Microsoft Edge Tools
configuration.hostname.description: The hostname on which to search for remote debuggable instances
configuration.port.description: The port on which to search for remote debuggable instances
configuration.useHttps.description: Should we request the remote target list using https rather than http
configuration.defaultUrl.description: The default url to open when launching the browser without a target
configuration.userDataDir.description: By default, Microsoft Edge is launched with a separate user profile in a temp folder. Use this option to override the path. You can also set to false to launch with your default user profile instead.
configuration.headless.description: Launch Microsoft Edge in headless mode. (requires relaunching Visual Studio Code)
configuration.browserArgs.description: Launch Microsoft Edge with specified args. (requires relaunching Visual Studio Code)
configuration.timeout.description: The number of milliseconds that the Microsoft Edge Tools will keep trying to attach the browser before timing out
configuration.browserFlavor.enum.default: Microsoft Edge Tools for VS Code will try to open the Microsoft Edge flavors in the following order: Stable, Beta, Dev and Canary
configuration.browserFlavor.enum.stable: Microsoft Edge Tools for VS Code will use Microsoft Edge Stable version
configuration.browserFlavor.enum.beta: Microsoft Edge Tools for VS Code will use Microsoft Edge Beta version
configuration.browserFlavor.enum.dev: Microsoft Edge Tools for VS Code will use Microsoft Edge Dev version
configuration.browserFlavor.enum.canary: Microsoft Edge Tools for VS Code will use Microsoft Edge Canary version
capabilities.untrustedWorkspaces.descrip: Workspace trust is needed to configure and debug projects
panel.title: Browser {0}: {1}
noBrowserInstances: No browser instances are currently open.
listOpenBrowsers.placeholder: Select a browser instance to view details
navigateBrowser.invalidUrl: URL must start with http://, https://, or file://
launchHtml.error: Please use this command from the context menu by right-clicking on an HTML file in the Explorer, or use "Microsoft Edge Tools: Launch Edge and then attach to a target" to open a browser with a URL.
